awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences:  Workshop on Applications of         Algebraic Geometry, San Juan, Puerto Rico; January 7-12,    1990
awd_abstract_narration: The subject of this workshop is the application of algebraic               geometry to information theory with emphasis on the theory of                   error correcting codes.  The workshop is to be held at the                      University of Puerto Rico, San Juan, during the time period                     January 7-12.  The purpose of the workshop is to bring together                 experts from both areas to learn and discuss the possible new                   avenues of further progress.                                                         Information theory, especially the theory of error                         correcting codes, is used to detect and correct errors in the                   electronic transmission of data.  This theory is important for                  high speed communications and computer systems.  The aim of this                workshop is to apply the mathematical theory of algebraic                       geometry to the information theory.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
